name: Mikrokosmos
description:
Note: It's recommended to download the application file below rather than running it in the browser because it's much smoother and includes the screen visualizer but can still be viewed this way if the app doesn't run on your computer. Does not support mobile devices.
On browser: hold esc and move mouse to refresh button to exit out of the simulation!

“Mikrokosmos” is an interactive concert experience showcasing the intricate visuals of the colored lightsticks that are mapped to each seat at a BTS concert. The lights move and change colors in time with the music, and other components like the dancing characters (originally designed by BTS themselves),  stage screens, live concert audio, and various different camera views help make the project come alive. 

My main goal is for every individual to feel like they are at a live concert, and to get exposed to something that they may be unfamiliar with. It's such a unique experience seeing so many lightsticks light up differently depending on where you're sitting. Every lightstick is independent of each other, which makes each person feel like their presence matters. I hope my project conveys that feeling of belonging and can be an overall fun experience for everyone!

Controls:

Use the mouse to look around the screen and press numbers 1-6 on the keyboard to change the camera view.

Camera 6 is a free roam cam. Use the WASD keys to move around, Q to go down, and E to go up! R resets the camera.
